sub_topic: Identifying the clique number of a graph.
message_1: Consider a graph G with six vertices, such that every pair of vertices is connected by an edge. Determine the size of the largest complete subgraph of G, also known as the clique number of the graph.
message_2:
A graph with six vertices in which every pair of vertices is connected by an edge is called a complete graph, denoted by K_6. In a complete graph, every vertex is connected to every other vertex.

A complete subgraph (or clique) is a subgraph in which every pair of distinct vertices is connected by an edge. The clique number of a graph is the size of the largest complete subgraph.

In the case of K_6, the largest complete subgraph is the graph itself, as every vertex is connected to every other vertex. Therefore, the clique number of the graph G (K_6) is 6.
